summary: This document is a detailed phone bill for an account, showing itemized local, long distance, and international call charges from June 15-20, 2006. It lists numerous calls to and from locations in New York, including White Plains, New York City, and the Bronx, with call types and charges. The document appears to be a financial record potentially related to tracking communications. This document is a series of itemized T-Mobile phone bills from June-July 2006, showing detailed call logs, text messages, and premium service charges. The records show frequent calls to/from locations in New York, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, and Brooklyn, with many calls occurring late at night and early morning. The document appears to be financial evidence, likely subpoenaed, showing communication patterns. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 30-45 of 97) for an account, showing itemized local, long distance, and international call charges from June 25-29, 2006. It reveals a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City area locations including White Plains, the Bronx, Brooklyn, and Queens, as well as some calls to Dale City, Virginia. The record is significant for establishing communication patterns and potential contacts during the investigation. This document is a detailed itemized telephone bill for an account, covering local, long distance, and international charges from June 29, 2006, to July 6, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City area numbers, including many to/from White Plains, NY. The document is part of the financial records collected in the Epstein case. This document is a multi-page itemized telephone bill for an account, detailing local, long distance, and international call charges from July 6-10, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City and White Plains, NY, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document appears to be financial evidence, likely subpoenaed for investigation into communication patterns. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for an account, covering local, long distance, and international call charges from July 10-18, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City area locations, including White Plains, New York City, the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, Yonkers, and Ossining, with some international calls to Toronto. The document is significant as it provides a log of communication patterns and locations during this period, which could be relevant for establishing timelines and contacts in the Epstein case. This document is a detailed itemized telephone bill for an account, covering local airtime, long distance, and messaging charges from July 2006. It shows a high volume of calls and text messages between New York City area numbers, including White Plains and the Bronx, over a period of several days. The bill was generated on July 21, 2006. This document is a series of T-Mobile phone bill pages showing detailed itemized messaging and call charges for an account from July 2006. It records numerous text messages and calls to/from locations including White Plains, NY, New York, NY, and the Bronx, indicating high-volume communication activity. The document appears to be financial evidence, likely subpoenaed, showing communication patterns.

The bill includes calls to various New York City boroughs (Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn) and other locations like Catonsville, MD.
Call types are coded, with (F) for Mobile2Mobile being the most frequent, indicating calls between mobile phones on the same network.
